Node.definition: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

Node.gloss: to make a covenant|to make a treaty
Node.definition: literally: to cut (a covenant); hence: = action by which two or more parties make a solemn agreement, accompanied by stipulations, blessings, and curses

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to look closely|to take note|to pay attention|to consider|to understand|to draw understanding
Node.definition: = action by which someone observes something carefully, with the intention of seeing through the outward appearance of things and grasping their essence, and so gain knowledge and understanding
= young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= something that happens to someone; ◄ whether or not as recompense for what he/she has done
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: to count (someone's) steps; hence: = action by which deities keep track of everything someone does
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions
= action by which someone performs an event quickly
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet

= contraption consisting of rod held by a cord in the middle and with pans attached to both ends; ► used for weighing objects; sometimes used figuratively in expressions describing people's status or integrity or the seriousness of a situation in terms of weight
= state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
literally: to turn aside (from the right way); hence: = action by which humans deviate from what is considered to be the right way to conduct their lives

literally: the act or movement of putting one leg in front of the other in walking, used exclusively in a figurative way to denote part of one's journey through life; hence: = something that is being done and, when God is the agent, something that other people ought to do as well; at the same time one can easily slip and fall, which is a metaphor for failure
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is committed to follow Y's leadership and example

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

literally: palm of the hand, but used in a figurative sense with the focus on the activities that are performed with one's hands; = someone's actions, whether or not performed with one's hands, for which one is personally responsible
= state in which an object is positioned around or against another object in such a way that the two cannot be separated easily
literally: blemish, defect; hence: = state in which humans are guilty of misbehavior, which is a stain on their reputation

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= object which derives from or comes from another object, used for plants and, by extension, for humans
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to lure|to allure|to entice|to coax|to persuade|to seduce|to flatter|to trick|to deceive
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities provoke in (other) humans the will or desire to do something
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= the opening by which a person enters or exits an enclosed space, such as a house, a tent, a temple, or a larger area like a city; it can also be used figuratively to denote the mouth
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance

Node.gloss: to lie in wait|to lay an ambush|to lurk
Node.definition: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it
= causative action by which humans reduce objects to tiny particles or powder with the help of a hand mill or larger millstone; ≈ regarded as a menial task
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= action by which humans or animals bend their knees, in order to lay down, give birth, have sex, or to be killed
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
literally: plan; hence: = a state of moral and ethical corruption, starting with evil plans and resulting in depraved practices, ≈ regarded as foolishness
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= abode of the dead; ≈ seen as a place extremely remote from the activities of everyday life but still accessible to God
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

= woman who is the legal property of someone else; either married or eligible for marriage; her children belong to the person who owns her; ≈ because of this an אָמָה appears to have a somewhat higher status than a שִׁפְחָה even though both terms are sometimes used interchangeably

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
literally: to bring back; hence: = action by which humans or deities respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= causative action by which humans or deities bring an object into existence

= part of the lower body of women and mammals where offspring are conceived and in which they grow until their birth; ≈ sometimes extended to refer to a woman, the time of birth, the place where something is produced, and the innermost part of an area
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

Node.gloss: to cause (someone's) eyes to grow dim
Node.definition: literally: to finish (someone's) eyes; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause the eyes of others to become affected by excessive weeping
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= a relatively small quantity of food
= state of being integrated but physically detached from other, similar objects or events
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

= person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor
= the period of a person's life between childhood and adulthood
= process by which young humans or animals undergo the natural development of increasing in size and changing physically on their way to being fully grown
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= generic designation for any article of clothing

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: covering; hence: the clothing that are needed for protection against the cold and enable people to function within their community
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= area located on both sides of spine between false ribs and hip bone; ◄ part of human body; ≈ often used to indicate the entire waist region of the body; euphemism for male genitals
= causative action by which humans cut off the wool of a sheep or other animal
= young of a sheep (שֶׂה) either male or female; ► eaten at Passover, and used for sacrifice; its fleece is used for clothing
= action by which humans cause themselves to feel warm or hot
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

= person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor
literally: to wave (one's) hand (against someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities engage in an act of violence against (other) humans

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier
= the joint between each arm and the main part of the human body; ► often used for carrying heavy weights
= the upper part of the human body between the head and the chest; ≈ associated with heavy burdens, and, in a more figurative way, heave responsibilities
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control
= each of the two upper limbs of the human body from the shoulder to the hand; ≈ associated with action and strength
exact meaning unsure: = upper part of the arm or shoulder
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling
= extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

literally: lifted up = state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= state where humans feel confident◄ due to their reliance on God or something else for protection
= poetic term for gold (זָהָב)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= objects that people possess in a relatively large quantity; ≈ greatly valued by the owner, strongly coveted by other people, and a cause of status
= state in which objects are large in quantity
literally: (one's) hand finds (something); hence: = state in which humans have the financial means to acquire something
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome
= one of the celestial bodies which govern time, seasons and other events on earth, marked by a white and cold light and seen by night
literally: precious; hence: = state in which a condition or activity is highly appreciated or considered of high significance
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

Node.gloss: to lure|to allure|to entice|to coax|to persuade|to seduce|to flatter|to trick|to deceive
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities provoke in (other) humans the will or desire to do something
= state in which knowledge, an object, or an action is kept hidden or unknown from others
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= action with which a person touches her or his lips to another person (usually on the lips or cheek or hand) or to an object ► to show love or respect or devotion; also used when greeting and saying goodbye

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= action by which humans act in a way that is not loyal to the deity that they have promised to serve
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= person who experiences hostily towards someone else and acts accordingly
= action by which someone ends a period of inactivity and comes into action, ◄ as if he had been sleeping for a certain time
literally: (an event) finds (people); = process by which humans eventually undergo a certain event, ◄ as if that event had been searching for them
= state of an event or an object that is very difficult or painful or harmful; also used to describe the attitude or emotion in reaction to such an event
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body; ► plays an important role in actions like speaking, blowing, kissing, biting, tasting, and chewing

= action by which someone or something is consigned to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, anger, or hostility; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= human beings, regardless of sex and age
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= causative process by which humans or deities cause the desire of (other) humans to be fulfilled
= referent to the location outside of an object
= action when people or objects stay overnight in a certain place

= state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker classes within the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the widows, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

= a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability
= relatively narrow road (דֶּרֶךְ) that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
literally: to cover (information); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities keep certain information hidden from others

= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality|= first man; ◄ created by God; ► husband of Eve (חַוָּה) father of Cain (קַיִן) Abel (הֶבֶל) and Seth (שֵׁת)
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= causative action by which humans make sure that certain information remains unknown to others
= small bag formed by a folded piece of cloth; ◄ part a garment; ► used to carry small objects, ≈ which will not be visible from the outside and therefore associated with secrecy
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= a large group of people
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= a particular group or class of either people (as in a clan or tribe) or animals (as in a genus or species) that share common characteristics
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to lack inner strength and courage

Node.gloss: to be silent|to keep silent|to remain silent|to be silenced
Node.definition: = to refrain from speaking

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= the opening by which a person enters or exits an enclosed space, such as a house, a tent, a temple, or a larger area like a city; it can also be used figuratively to denote the mouth

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage
= causative action by which humans create a written document, such as a letter, book, or song
literally: person of contention; therefore = someone who is in contention with or opposes a person or deity, usually involving a legal or ethical dispute
= particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement
= the upper part of the human body between the head and the chest; ≈ associated with heavy burdens, and, in a more figurative way, heave responsibilities

literally: to hold, carry; hence: = state in which humans hold something by attaching it to their clothes or by hiding it in the fold of their robes; ≈ often associated with carrying some amount of responsibility for something as well

= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection
= an oral or written account of something
= a person in a position of high authority over a nation, a division of priests or levites, or an army

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= long, narrow trench made in the soil by a plow

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
literally: strength; hence: = the products of the field that people have produced with their strength and ability
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband
= cereal plant bearing dense four sided spike of grain; ◄ Triticum; ► important source of flour for bread; ≈ its color used to be regarded as the ideal color for the skin
literally: to come out; = process by which land or a living organism produces crops, branches, horns, or fruits
= plant with thorns; ► useless; ≈ regarded as ugly and useless

= a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed
= undesirable plant product, probably bad smelling and inedible
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job
